result.title: Biodiversity, biogeography and GOODS classification system under current climate conditions and future IPCC scenarios
result.description: Report on the predictive species and habitat distribution models (SDMs, HDMs) using quality-assured occurrences of VME indicator taxa and deep-sea fish species, outputs from VIKING20 mixing and transport, and data on realistic organic matter supply. SDMs will be used to refine GOODS classification for these taxa. Report prepared on potential for changes in biodiversity, the refined GOODS classification, and GES under future IPCC scenarios of the N Atlantic.

result.title: Reproduction, Dispersal and genetic connectivity in benthos and fish
result.description: Report on how life history traits of selected benthos and fish may mediate dispersal potential and genetic connectivity. Report on genetic data analysis, with maps produced in GIS illustrating network of connectivity for all species retained. Report outlining the genetic connectivity of deep-sea fish stocks and those that may be considered under Blue Growth scenarios (e.g. mesopelagic fish), and a summary of evidence for historical genetic bottlenecks related to fisheries over-exploitation.

result.title: Ecosystem goods and services valuation and environmental risk assessment
result.description: An atlas prepared that spatially delineates ecosystem goods and services alongside predicted SDMs and HDMs for each case study area. Risk assessment atlas: Overlap existing and future human use sector footprints (ODEMM and HERMIONE project data) with VME and fish habitat maps and use Marxan and other methods (e.g. as in CoralFISH) to measure the risk of activities impacting on VME or fish habitat extent. Risk assessments will be mapped in an atlas. Report on ocean monetary values of services based on markets and value transfer methods where primary studies exist (e.g. through the Ecosystem Services Valuation Database) for Atlantic case study areas.
